options.name: Conversational Agent
options.description: Describes tools in the system prompt and parses JSON responses for tool calls. More flexible but potentially less reliable than the Tools Agent. Suitable for simpler interactions or with models not supporting structured schemas.

options.name: OpenAI Functions Agent
options.description: Leverages OpenAI's function calling capabilities to precisely select and execute tools. Excellent for tasks requiring structured outputs when working with OpenAI models.

options.name: Plan and Execute Agent
options.description: Creates a high-level plan for complex tasks and then executes each step. Suitable for multi-stage problems or when a strategic approach is needed.

options.name: ReAct Agent
options.description: Combines reasoning and action in an iterative process. Effective for tasks that require careful analysis and step-by-step problem-solving.

options.name: SQL Agent
options.description: Specializes in interacting with SQL databases. Ideal for data analysis tasks, generating queries, or extracting insights from structured data.

options.name: Tools Agent
options.description: Utilizes structured tool schemas for precise and reliable tool selection and execution. Recommended for complex tasks requiring accurate and consistent tool usage, but only usable with models that support tool calling.

options.name: systemMessage
options.default:
Assistant is a large language model trained by OpenAI.

Assistant is designed to be able to assist with a wide range of tasks, from answering simple questions to providing in-depth explanations and discussions on a wide range of topics. As a language model, Assistant is able to generate human-like text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in natural-sounding conversations and provide responses that are coherent and relevant to the topic at hand.

Assistant is constantly learning and improving, and its capabilities are constantly evolving. It is able to process and understand large amounts of text, and can use this knowledge to provide accurate and informative responses to a wide range of questions. Additionally, Assistant is able to generate its own text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in discussions and provide explanations and descriptions on a wide range of topics.

Overall, Assistant is a powerful system that can help with a wide range of tasks and provide valuable insights and information on a wide range of topics. Whether you need help with a specific question or just want to have a conversation about a particular topic, Assistant is here to assist.

options.name: ignoredTables
options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to ignore from the database. If empty, no tables are ignored.

options.name: includedSampleRows
options.description: Number of sample rows to include in the prompt to the agent. It helps the agent to understand the schema of the database but it also increases the amount of tokens used.

options.name: includedTables
options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to include in the database. If empty, all tables are included.

options.name: prefixPrompt
options.default:
You are an agent designed to interact with an SQL database.
Given an input question, create a syntactically correct {dialect} query to run, then look at the results of the query and return the answer.
Unless the user specifies a specific number of examples they wish to obtain, always limit your query to at most {top_k} results using the LIMIT clause.
You can order the results by a relevant column to return the most interesting examples in the database.
Never query for all the columns from a specific table, only ask for a the few relevant columns given the question.
You have access to tools for interacting with the database.
Only use the below tools. Only use the information returned by the below tools to construct your final answer.
You MUST double check your query before executing it. If you get an error while executing a query, rewrite the query and try again.

DO NOT make any DML statements (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP etc.) to the database.

If the question does not seem related to the database, just return "I don't know" as the answer.
options.description: Prefix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: suffixPrompt
options.description: Suffix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: topK
options.description: The maximum number of results to return

options.name: humanMessageTemplate
options.description: The message that will be sent to the agent during each step execution

options.name: channelIdentification
options.description: Instructs Amazon Transcribe to process each audiochannel separately and then merge the transcription output of each channel into a single transcription. You can't set both Max Speaker Labels and Channel Identification in the same request. If you set both, your request returns a BadRequestException.

options.name: maxAlternatives
options.description: The number of alternative transcriptions that the service should return

options.name: maxSpeakerLabels
options.description: The maximum number of speakers to identify in the input audio. If there are more speakers in the audio than this number, multiple speakers are identified as a single speaker.

options.name: vocabularyName
options.description: Name of vocabulary to use when processing the transcription job

options.name: vocabularyFilterName
options.description: The name of the vocabulary filter to use when transcribing the audio. The filter that you specify must have the same language code as the transcription job.

options.name: vocabularyFilterMethod
options.description:
Set to mask to remove filtered text from the transcript and replace it with three asterisks ("***") as placeholder text.

Set to remove to remove filtered text from the transcript without using placeholder text. Set to tag to mark the word in the transcription output that matches the vocabulary filter. When you set the filter method to tag, the words matching your vocabulary filter are not masked or removed.

properties.description: By default, the response only contains metadata about the transcript. Enable this option to retrieve the transcript instead.

properties.description: List of input properties to avoid sending, separated by commas. Leave empty to send all properties.

properties.name: fieldsUi
properties.description: Field must be defined in the collection, otherwise it will be ignored. If field defined in the collection is not set here, it will be set to null.

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

values.name: batchSize
values.description: Input will be split in batches to throttle requests. -1 for disabled. 0 will be treated as 1.

values.name: batchInterval
values.description: Time (in milliseconds) between each batch of requests. 0 for disabled.

options.name: allowUnauthorizedCerts
options.description: Whether to accept the response even if SSL certificate validation is not possible

options.name: proxy
options.description: HTTP proxy to use. If authentication is required it can be defined as follow: http://username:password@myproxy:3128

options.name: timeout
options.description: Time in ms to wait for the server to send response headers (and start the response body) before aborting the request
